thread.title: Matt Damon movies, ranked from worst to best - Entertainment
thread.title_full: Matt Damon movies, ranked from worst to best - Entertainment

author: boston.com
title: Matt Damon movies, ranked from worst to best - Entertainment
text:
Previous -- of -- Next 40. "The Monuments Men" (2014) didn’t meet critics’ expectations, given a paltry 31 percent rating—critics thought the film didn’t live up to the engrossing narrative and nostalgic tone of the true story. Damon played one of eight who rescued art from the Nazis during World War II. Claudette Barius / Photo courtesy of Columbia Pictures Previous -- of -- Next 39. "All The Pretty Horses" (2000) was a critical bust with a 32 percent rating—critics claimed the romance between Damon and Penelope Cruz had no sparks and said the film was “rather flat.” The film tells the story of a cowboy falling in love with the daughter of a ranch owner in Mexico. Photo courtesy of Miramax Films Previous -- of -- Next 38. "The Brothers Grimm" (2005), a fantasy tale, received little love from critics and viewers, earning a shabby 38 percent rating from critics and 39 percent from the audience. Damon stars beside Heath Ledger in a narrative about a supernatural journey. Photo courtesy of Dimension Films Previous -- of -- Next 37. "The Legend of Bagger Vance" (2000) underperformed with a 43 percent rating. Critics argued the talent (Damon, Will Smith, and Charlize Theron) was there, but powerful characters and dialogue were not. In the film, a golfer (Damon) attempts to find his game with help from a caddy (Smith). Photo by David James / Dreamworks Previous -- of -- Next 36. "Happy Feet Two" (2011), the sequel to "Happy Feet," was a critical flop in comparison to its predecessor, receiving a 46 percent rating. Though he didn’t have a lead role, Damon supplied the voice of Bob the Krill. Photo courtesy of Warner Brothers Pictures Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next 35. "Hereafter" (2010) narrates the story of three strangers all touched by death, whose lives intersect and change after they learn about an afterlife. Despite its potential, critics gave the film a 46 percent rating. Ken Regan / Warner Bros. Pictures Previous -- of -- Next 34. "Promised Land" (2012), a movie Damon helped write, produce, and starred in, rose above average with a 51 percent rating. More complex characters could have helped it, critics said. The film explores the relationship between corporations and small rural towns. Scott Green / Focus Features Previous -- of -- Next 33. "Titan A.E." (2000), a science fiction animated film, has Damon as the voice of Cale, a boy on a mission to find the Titan spacecraft that can save humanity. It’s a middle-of-the-road film with a 52 percent rating. Photo courtesy of 20th Century Fox Previous -- of -- Next 32. "Geronimo - An American Legend" (1993) was one of Damon’s earliest acting gigs, and follows the events leading up to the capture of Geronimo, a prominent former Apache tribe leader. The film was given a 53 percent rating. Photo courtesy of Sony Pictures Previous -- of -- Next 31. "Green Zone" (2010) received a 53 percent rating. It’s an action flick about an officer who teams up with a senior CIA officer to find evidence of weapons of mass destruction in Iraq. Jasin Boland / AP Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next 30. "The Good Shepherd" (2006), a movie with a powerhouse cast, did better than average with a 54 percent rating from critics. It’s a fictional film loosely based on real events: the birth of the Central Intelligence Agency. Handout photo Previous -- of -- Next 29. Ocean’s Twelve (2004), the second of a three-movie series, did better than average with a 55% freshness rating. It fell short of its predecessor, Ocean’s Eleven, and its sequel, Ocean’s Thirteen. Ralph Nelson / Warner Brothers Pictures Previous -- of -- Next 28. "Gerry" (2003), a film with a 61 percent freshness rating, sees Damon joining Casey Affleck on an adventure in the wild. Photo courtesy of Gus Van Sant Previous -- of -- Next 27. "Stuck on You" (2003) is a Farrelly Brothers comedy centered around the lives of conjoined twins Bob and Walt Tenor, whose personalities and career aspirations try to pull them apart. The movie received a 60 percent rating. Glenn Watson / 20th Century Fox Previous -- of -- Next 26. "Rounders" (1998), a film about the secretive world of high-stake poker and its addictive features, earned a 65 percent rating from critics. John Clifford / Miramax Films Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next 25. "We Bought a Zoo" (2011) sat pretty well with critics, earning a 66 percent freshness rating. Damon’s character is a single father seeking a fresh start who was willing to do something outrageous—he bought a zoo and lived in it. Neal Preston / 20th Century Fox Previous -- of -- Next 24. "Dogma" (1999), one of the many films buds Damon and Ben Affleck have starred in together, did well with critics and really well with viewers. The ecclectic Kevin Smith comedy received a 67 percent rating from critics while 85 percents of viewers liked it. Handout photo Previous -- of -- Next 23. "Elysium" (2013), the dystopian science fiction thriller set in year 2154, earned a favorable 68% rating. Kimberley French / Columbia Pictures Previous -- of -- Next 22. "Spirit - Stallion of the Cimarron" (2002) doesn’t feature Damon’s acting, but he plays the voice of Spirit the Mustang stallion. The animated film received a 69 percent rating. AFP / AMPAS Previous -- of -- Next 21. "Ocean’s Thirteen" (2007), the final installment of the Ocean’s trilogy, had high expectations to meet. It didn’t disappoint many people, acquiring a 70 percent freshness rating from critics and a 75 percent audience score. Melinda Sue Gordon / Warner Brothers Pictures Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next 20. "The Adjustment Bureau" (2011) ranked highly among critics, scoring a 72 percent freshness rating. In the film, Damon’s character defies the agents of Fate to be with the women he loves. Photo courtesy of Andrew Schwartz Previous -- of -- Next 19. "Interstellar" (2014) was a success among critics and at the box office, receiving a 72 percent rating and $675 million at the box office. Though Damon didn’t lead in this film, his character is still well-known and plays an important role. Mellinda Sue Gordon / AP Previous -- of -- Next 18. "Syriana" (2006) sat favorably among critics with a 72 percent freshness rating, due to its complexity and levels of intellect. Photo courtesy of Warner Brothers Previous -- of -- Next 17. "Margaret" (2011), a gripping and emotional narrative, earned a 74 percent freshness rating. Not a leading man in this film, Damon kicks back and plays Mr. Aaron, Margaret’s teacher who she develops a strong relationship with. Handout photo Previous -- of -- Next 16. "Invictus" (2009), a film with a 71 percent freshness rating, did so well thanks to Matt Damon and Morgan Freeman. The film tells the true story of the partnership between former South African president Nelson Mandela and the South African rugby team captain, and their attempt at uniting their country in the wake of apartheid. Keith Bernstein / Warner Brothers Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next 15. "The Informant" (2009) portrays Damon as a corporate whistleblower for the FBI. According to a general critics consensus, the film’s satire plus Damon’s on-screen charisma helped the film earn a 79 percent freshness rating. Mitch Haddad / ABC Previous -- of -- Next 14. "The Bourne Supremacy" (2004). the sequel to "The Bourne Identity," proved itself by meeting the audience and critics’ high expectations. It scored an 81 percent rating, only two percent lower than its predecessor. Jasin Boland / AP Previous -- of -- Next 13. "The Rainmaker" (1997) stars a young Damon as an inexperienced law-school grad ready to fight for a terminally ill 22-year-old’s life, whose insurance company won’t pay for a potentially life-saving surgery. Critics were satisfied with the drama, giving it an 82 percent rating. Phillip V. Caruso / Paramount Pictures Previous -- of -- Next 12. "Ocean’s Eleven" (2001), the first of the Ocean’s trilogy, set the series up for success with its star-studded cast playing a crew of witty con artists ready to pull of the greatest heist of all time. The movie received an 82 percent rating. Bob Marshak / Warner Brothers Pictures Previous -- of -- Next 11. "The Talented Mr. Ripley" (1999) is certified fresh with an 83 percent rating. In the film, Damon’s character is a charismatic psycopath who murders a man he’s attracted to in order to steal his identity and life. It’s based on the first of a series of novels by Patricia Highsmith. Merline Archives Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next 10. "The Bourne Identity" (2002), the first of the spy thriller series, was very well received with an 83 percent rating. Jason Bourne, played by Damon, is completely without identity and is being chased by killers; he possess a range of talents in fighting and linguistics that indicates his past as a spy assassin. Photo courtesy of Universal Studios Previous -- of -- Next 9. "Contagion" (2011) can credit its 84 percent rating to its smart plot and stellar cast, according to critics. The film recounts the story of a medical community rushing to find the cure to a fast-spreading epidemic. Damon starred alongside Marion Cotillard, Laurence Fishburne, Gwyneth Paltrow, Jude Law, and Kate Winslet. Claudette Barius / Warner Brothers Pictures Previous -- of -- Next 8. "Courage Under Fire" (1996) shows a young Matt Damon taking a back seat to Denzel Washington and Meg Ryan, but his performance as a medic specialist is still worthy. The film earned an 85 percent freshess rating. Merie W. Wallace / 20th Century Fox Previous -- of -- Next 7. "The Departed" (2006) hits home for Bostonians, following the story of a South Boston Irish mob. The authentic drama earned an outstanding 91% freshness rating, being the first of Damon’s films to reach the 90s level. -Andrew Cooper / Warner Brothers Pictures Previous -- of -- Next 6. "Saving Private Ryan" (1998) features an excellent cast that delivers a powerful and realistic war drama directed by Steven Spielberg. The film earned a 92 percent rating, and 11 Academy Award nominations that year. globe photo/David James Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Previous -- of -- Next 5. "Ponyo" (2008), a Disney animated film with a 92 percent rating, deals with the friendship between five-year-old Sosuke and Ponyo, a princess goldfish who wants to be a human. Damon supplies the voice of Koichi, Sosuke’s father. Photo courtesy of Walt Disney Previous -- of -- Next 4. "The Bourne Ultimatum" (2007) is the third of the Bourne film series with another thrilling spy narrative. The third installment earned the best mark in the series with a 93 percent freshness rating. Jason Boland / Universal Pictures Previous -- of -- Next 3. "Behind the Candelabra" (2013) looks at the relationship between 18-year-old Scott Thorson (Damon) and extravagant entertainer Liberace (Michael Douglas). Critics praised Damon and Douglas’ performances, granting the movie a stellar 95 percent rating. Claudette Barius / HBO Previous -- of -- Next 2. "True Grit" (2010) racked up an almost-perfect 96 percent rating that featured strong performances by Damon, Jeff Bridges, and Hailee Steinfeld. Lorey Sebastian / Paramount Pictures Previous -- of -- Next 1. "Good Will Hunting" (1997) undoubtedly has a big spot in Boston’s heart—it was written by two Cambridge actors, took place in our city, and launched Cambridge’s very own Damon and Ben Affleck into stardom. The emotionally rich drama has a well-earned 97 percent rating. George Kraychyk / AP Previous -- of -- Next Advertisement Matt Damon’s name is stamped on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, he shares an Academy Award and a Golden Globe for Best Screenplay with buddy Ben Affleck, and has received plenty of award nominations. Accomplished is the least we can say.
He’s been around for more than 20 years, and with “Bourne 5” already in the works and “The Martian” coming out today, it doesn’t look like he plans on stopping anytime soon. But even Damon is familiar with several critical and box office busts. We took a look at Damon’s leading and supporting roles, and ranked the films based on the freshness rating of critical aggregator Rotten Tomatoes. Here is a look.

09.25.15 | 1:16 PM Entertainment Why we think The Simpsons live in Springfield, Massachusetts 09.25.15 | 9:34 AM Events Somerville’s annual Fluff Festival is this Saturday 09.24.15 | 9:05 PM News Bandmates of slain Brigham and Women’s surgeon remember their friend with concert 09.24.15 | 8:22 PM Music 10 Boston Calling acts you need to know 09.24.15 | 2:38 PM Entertainment Meet the man who makes City Hall Plaza shine during Boston Calling 09.24.15 | 1:46 PM Technology WGBH to acquire Boston’s GlobalPost 09.24.15 | 10:48 AM Entertainment UMass Lowell will feature Jack Kerouac’s personal items at a new exhibit 09.24.15 | 10:25 AM
